result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Allen Henkel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: PWID Controlled Substance on/near Craig School], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.
  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Possess Controlled Substance on/near Certain Places], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $518 Paid in Full from Bond Posted

Defendant Richard Allen Henkel in court with attorney Patricia L. Arreazola.  Scott H. Dirks appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deft pleads Guilty freely and voluntarily to Count 1; Deft pleads No Contest freely and voluntarily to Count 2; Court accepts plea and finds Deft Guilty; Court orders: Sentence withhelda: 5 years Probation, Concurrent with each count, COUNT 1 ONLY:  1 year RCJail with Huber for employment and Medical and Medical for wife, Jail Diversion Program, call by 03-31-2015, Report by 06-09-2015; COUNT 2 ONLY:  100 Hours Community Service; $961 costs, paid from Bond Posted, balance returned to poster; 1 day credit, if Revoked.
